intro: Pentaclethra brevifila, commonly known as the short-bristled or simply the pentaclethra, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to thrive in humid, warm climates. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species for biodiversity conservation.
